column1: Welcome to Sport, Health, Leisure and Nutrition (SHLN).

column4: All Saints. We now offer an amazing  twelve different

column1: The Academic year of 2005-6 was a very successful year in spite of difficulties resulting from the lecturers&rsquo
column2: pay dispute. A stressful time for all, but the team spirit of staff and students in SHLN enabled all students' work to be assessed in time for students to graduate or progress to the next year of their studies.

column1: A number of internal and external surveys of the quality of the student experience in SHLN showed a high level of student satisfaction and success after graduation. Highlights of the College Learning and Teaching Survey 2005-6 were the contact between tutors and students, quality of teaching and information. This was backed up by the National Student Survey (2005) which identified scores above the sector average for &lsquo
column2: overall satisfaction with the  quality of the course&rsquo
column6: The Guardian Higher Education League  Tables&nbsp
column7: also placed us highly among sports science providers.

column1: Both the College and the department believe strongly that students should be well prepared for graduate employment on leaving us. There is therefore a strong professional focus to all our degrees, including periods of professional experience. The value of this focus was borne out by Trinity &
column4: in the 2005 Sunday Times University Guide: 97.8% of graduates were in employment six months after graduation.

column1: There are several exciting new developments. A major  building programme will include&nbsp
column2: a new sports hall, fitness room and treatment rooms. This will provide not only enhanced teaching space but improved competition and recreation facilities for all students.

column1: Complimentary to this development will be the creation of a  Wellness centre and an after school, evening, weekend&nbsp
column2: and vacation activity programme. You will  have the opportunity to help deliver these programmes as part of our Student  Sport&nbsp
column3: Action Scheme programme. During 2006-7 there will be training courses to prepare you for voluntary and paid work.
